newsitem.title: GERMANY: SKW Trostberg to recommend 96 div up 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: SKW Trostberg to recommend 96 div up 10 pct.

text.p: German specialty chemicals company SKW Trostberg AG said on Wednesday that it would recommend a ten percent higher dividend for its 1996 results.

Management board chairman Wilhelm Simson, said at a news conference to announce nine-month figures: "We cannot give a prognosis but we can give a recommendation, and we will recommend that the dividend be raised."
Klaus-Juergen Schulz, SKW Trostberg's chief financial officer, said: "The group expects to recommend raising the dividend by 10 percent from the 1995 level."
In 1995 Trostberg paid out a dividend of one mark.
